unnormalised: **What are some yoga practices that have significantly improved your well-being?**
normalised: What are some yoga practices that have significantly improved your well-being?

unnormalised: For me, yoga has been a game-changer! I started incorporating it into my daily routine about 6 months ago, initially just to relieve some lower back pain I’d developed from sitting at my desk all day. I work as a software engineer at TCS, Bangalore, and spend at least 8 hours a day hunched over a computer.
normalised: For me, yoga has been a game-changer! I started incorporating it into my daily routine about six months ago, initially just to relieve some lower back pain I’d developed from sitting at my desk all day. I work as a software engineer at T C S, Bangalore, and spend at least eight hours a day hunched over a computer.

unnormalised: Initially, I started with Sun Salutations (Surya Namaskar). Doing just 5 rounds of Surya Namaskar every morning has made a noticeable difference in my energy levels. Later, I added Pranayama, especially Anulom Vilom, which my grandmother (Dadi) swore by for calming the mind.
normalised: Initially, I started with Sun Salutations (Surya Namaskar). Doing just five rounds of Surya Namaskar every morning has made a noticeable difference in my energy levels. Later, I added Pranayama, especially Anulom Vilom, which my grandmother (Dadi) swore by for calming the mind.

unnormalised: *   **Asanas:** Trikonasana (Triangle Pose) and Virabhadrasana II (Warrior II) for strength and balance. I even managed to do a headstand (Sirsasana) with the help of my yoga instructor, Ms. Sharma.
normalised: *   **Asanas:** Trikonasana (Triangle Pose) and Virabhadrasana two (Warrior two) for strength and balance. I even managed to do a headstand (Sirsasana) with the help of my yoga instructor, Missus Sharma.

unnormalised: *   **Pranayama:** Kapalabhati and Bhastrika for cleansing. I read somewhere that breathing exercises can actually increase your lung capacity.
normalised: *   **Pranayama:** Kapalabhati and Bhastrika for cleansing. I read somewhere that breathing exercises can actually increase your lung capacity.

unnormalised: *   **Meditation:** Even 10 minutes of guided meditation helps me manage stress levels. I often use Insight Timer.
normalised: *   **Meditation:** Even ten minutes of guided meditation helps me manage stress levels. I often use Insight Timer.

unnormalised: My yoga studio is quite small, maybe just 400 sq ft, but it's a peaceful haven. I also try to walk 2 km to the nearby park whenever I can for some fresh air. I've seen Dr. Patil at the local clinic for some minor things and he also recommends yoga for overall wellness. Investing in a good yoga mat (Rs. 1500 well spent!) and comfortable clothing has made a huge difference. What yoga practices have worked for you? Share your experiences!
normalised: My yoga studio is quite small, maybe just four hundred square feet, but it's a peaceful haven. I also try to walk two kilometer to the nearby park whenever I can for some fresh air. I've seen Doctor Patil at the local clinic for some minor things and he also recommends yoga for overall wellness. Investing in a good yoga mat (rupees one thousand five hundred well spent!) and comfortable clothing has made a huge difference. What yoga practices have worked for you? Share your experiences!
